newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - May 28.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - May 28.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The Philippine Navy has arrested 21 Chinese fishermen near the disputed Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea, sparking another protest from the Chinese government, officials say. (PHILIPPINE DAILY INQUIRER)
- Cities, towns and villages in northern Luzon start cleaning up after flash floods caused by a tropical depression left 53 dead and 77,000 displaced. (ALL PAPERS)

- Senate majority floor leader Francisco Tatad wants the Philippines to offer the United States a new base facility in the country amid rising tension with China over the Spratlys and Scarborough Shoal (PHILIPPINE STAR)
- President Fidel Ramos authorises the Armed Forces of the Philippines to use its full force in wiping out kindapping syndicates in southern Mindanao island. (MANILA STANDARD)
